alert.note: Alert for San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 4:49AM CDT until October 26 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble, Mason and San Saba. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated mainly light to moderate showers. Runoff from earlier heavy rain is likely continuing, especially in San Saba county where more than 5 inches of rain has fallen over the past 12 hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cherokee, Pontotoc, Art, Hedwigs Hill, Loyal Valley, Hilda, Chappel, Bend and Us-87 Near The Mason-Gillespie County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... RM 385 crossing Falls Prong, RM 385 crossing Perdenales River, CR 424 crossing Rough Creek, Old Union crossing San Fernando Creek, Old Union crossing, Hickory Grove crossing Elm Creek, West Simonsville crossing, Simonsville crossing Bader Creek, Simonsville crossing Beaver Creek and Ranch Road 783 crossing Bader Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
